meanings.definition: To call out to someone in a friendly or welcoming way.
meanings.sent1: She hulloed her friend from across the street.
meanings.sent2: He hulloed to his neighbor as he passed by.
meanings.sent3: The little girl hulloed to her cat to come inside for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The hiker hulloed to the lost dog in the woods, hoping to guide it back.
meanings.sent5: The coach hulloed to the team, encouraging them to keep pushing forward.

meanings.definition: To greet someone with a loud voice.
meanings.sent1: The crowd hulloed the arrival of the famous singer.
meanings.sent2: She hulloed with excitement when she saw her best friend at the party.
meanings.sent3: The children hulloed with joy when they saw the ice cream truck approaching.
meanings.sent4: The fans hulloed their support for the winning team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hulloed the students into the classroom for the surprise activity.

meanings.definition: To shout or cry out to get someone's attention.
meanings.sent1: He hulloed for help when he got stuck in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard hulloed to the swimmer in distress.
meanings.sent3: The toddler hulloed for his favorite toy that was out of reach.
meanings.sent4: She hulloed to her brother to warn him about the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The farmer hulloed to his workers to gather for the harvest.
